medical_history.chief_complaint: Segmental midfacial hemangioma with recurrent hemorrhages.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The hemangioma was noted at birth, with episodes of spontaneous bleeding and staphylococcal superinfection occurring subsequently. The infant was treated with prednisolone, but continued to experience bleeding until endovascular embolization was performed at 5 months of age, after which there was a progressive decrease in size over the following months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hospitalization due to spontaneous bleeding and staphylococcal superinfection of the facial hemangioma.
medical_history.social_history: Born via normal vaginal delivery to a healthy, non-consanguineous couple of Haitian origin. Normal pregnancy without complications.
